nexttext:
\noindent In order to ensure consistency with the predictions made at low drug levels (as analyzed in \cite{Gevertz15}), we calibrated model parameters and found that the best fit was achieved for $K_{max} = 0.0004$ and $k_n \approx 2.195\times 10^{-4}$. Just as in \cite{Gevertz15}, when the intracellular damage level $C_k^{dam}$ exceeds the death threshold $C_k^{death}$, the cell will die.

In the case of pre-existing drug resistance, a fixed number of cells will be less sensitive to the DNA damaging drug, meaning they can tolerate more damage than the baseline case. These resistant cells have a death threshold of $C_k^{death} = Thr_{multi}\times Thr_{death}$, where $Thr_{multi}$ is the pre-existing resistance parameter in the model. The larger $Thr_{multi}$ is, the more resistant this subpopulation of cells is compared to the chemosensitive subpopulation.

In the case of acquired resistance, the death threshold of each cell $C_k^{death}$ increases independently at the rate $\Delta_{death}$ if the prolonged drug exposure criterion is met:

prevtext:
\noindent In order to ensure consistency with the predictions made at low drug levels (as analyzed in \cite{Gevertz15}), we calibrated model parameters and found that the best fit was achieved for $K_{max} = 0.0004$ and $k_n \approx 2.195\times 10^{-4}$. Just as in \cite{Gevertz15}, when the intracellular damage level $C_k^{dam}$ exceeds the death threshold $C_k^{death}$, the cell will die.

In the case of pre-existing drug resistance, a fixed number of cells will be less sensitive to the DNA damaging drug, meaning they can tolerate more damage than the baseline case. These resistant cells have a death threshold of $C_k^{death} = Thr_{multi}\times Thr_{death}$, where $Thr_{multi}$ is the pre-existing resistance parameter in the model. The larger $Thr_{multi}$ is, the more resistant this subpopulation of cells is compared to the chemosensitive subpopulation.

In the case of acquired resistance, the death threshold of each cell $C_k^{death}$ increases independently at the rate $\Delta_{death}$ if the prolonged drug exposure criterion is met:

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E4.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="C_{k}^{death}(t+\Delta t)=\left\{\begin{array}[]{ll}C_{k}^{death}(t)+\Delta_{%
death}&\mbox{ if }C_{k}^{exp}(t)>t_{exp}\\
C_{k}^{death}(t)&\mbox{ otherwise.}\\
\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi>C</mi><mi>k</mi><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi>C</mi><mi>k</mi><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mtext> if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>C</mi><mi>k</mi><mrow><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>p</mi></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><msubsup><mi>C</mi><mi>k</mi><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mtext> otherwise.</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mi/></mrow></mrow></math>
